Name: Buenos Aires
Description: The largest province, home to the capital city, Buenos Aires, known for its cultural vibrancy, agriculture, and coastlines.

Name: Catamarca
Description: Known for its mountainous terrain, mining resources, and historical sites.
Capital: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca

Name: Chaco
Description: Located in the northeast, known for its forests, agriculture, and indigenous cultures.

Name: Chubut
Description: Famous for its Patagonian landscapes, coastal areas, and natural reserves.

Name: Córdoba
Description: Known for its colonial architecture, historical sites, and the central plains.

Name: Corrientes
Description: Known for its wetlands, rivers, and vibrant folk culture.

Name: Entre Ríos
Description: Known for its rivers, agricultural production, and thermal tourism.

Name: Formosa
Description: A sparsely populated province known for its wetlands and biodiversity.

Name: Jujuy
Description: Located in the northwest, known for its Andean mountains and indigenous culture.

Name: La Pampa
Description: Famous for its agricultural land and vast plains.

Name: La Rioja
Description: Known for its vineyards and arid landscapes.

Name: Mendoza
Description: Famous for its wine production and the Andes mountains.

Name: Misiones
Description: Known for the Iguazu Falls, tropical forests, and biodiversity.

Name: Neuquen
Description: Known for its Patagonian region, oil reserves, and natural parks.

Name: Rio Negro
Description: Famous for its agricultural production, including fruit orchards and vineyards.

Name: Salta
Description: Known for its rich colonial history, natural landscapes, and culture.

Name: San Juan
Description: Known for its wine production, desert landscapes, and mining industry.

Name: San Luis
Description: Known for its mountains, forests, and cultural landmarks.

Name: Santa Cruz
Description: A Patagonian province known for its glaciers, wildlife, and natural reserves.

Name: Santa Fe
Description: Known for its agricultural industry, the Paraná River, and its major cities, including Rosario.

Name: Santiago del Estero
Description: One of Argentina s oldest provinces, known for its historical significance and agriculture.

Name: Tierra del Fuego
Description: The southernmost province, known for its cold climate, glaciers, and maritime culture.

Name: Tucuman
Description: The smallest province, known for its sugarcane production and Andean foothills.
